8
The Human Body
There are essentially nine systems that are responsible for the 
structure and functions in the human body. The Circulatory and 
Respiratory Systems make oxygen and nutrients available to the 
entire body. The Digestive and Excretory Systems are responsible for making the nutrients available as well as for expelling out unwanted waste from the body. The Nervous and Endocrine 
Systems are principally involved in the coordination and control of 
the whole body. The Skeletal and the Muscular Systems support and enable the body to move.
